CatDescriptText: Judy DeJulia, beautician, Stowe Township and Mary Ann Krszal, beautician, Stowe Township, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, December 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think that President-elect Kennedy was sincere in offering Congressman William Dawson, of Chicago, the cabinet position of Postmaster-General?"  Ms. DeJulia's answer reads: "Yes I think he was sincere.  And, the reason, well, I don't question his judgement."  Mrs. Krszal's answer reads: "I think so, and the reason is because I have confidence in him.  He has made a lot of other selections and these picks have been all right."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Judy DeJulia wearing dark double breasted coat with fur collar, standing in front of store window with Hallmark sign; Portrait of Mary Ann Krszal wearing light colored plush coat, standing in front of granite wall
